thread.title: Education Minister and Habayit Hayehudi chairman Naftali Ben
thread.title_full: Education Minister and Habayit Hayehudi chairman Naftali Ben

author: Barak Ravid
title: Education Minister and Habayit Hayehudi chairman Naftali Ben
text:
Education Minister and Habayit Hayehudi chairman Naftali Bennett slammed Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for saying on Thursday that he wishes to meet Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in Jordan in effort to restore calm.
"Abu Mazen (Abbas) is the incitement snake's head," Bennett told Channel 2. "He created a new blood libel about a child that IDF soldiers supposedly murdered . I think it's wrong to beseech him and call on him to meet. "
Bennett added: "The world is longing for a clear statement by the State of Israel that Abbas isn't a partner, and that Israel objects to a Palestinian state. Abu Mazen is a terrorist, one shouldn't talk with him."
On Thursday, Netanyahu said that he is " completely open " to meeting Abbas and other Arab leaders. "I think it is potentially useful because it might stop the wave of incitement," he said during a press conference at the Foreign Ministry.
His comments also came after Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on Wednesday accused Israel of executing 13-year-old Ahmed Manasra, who stabbed two Israelis, even though he was still alive .
Netanyahu blasted the Palestinian president's comments as lies and said that "the current campaign [of terror attacks] is the result of Palestinian incitement," he said, claiming "President Abbas continues to incite and lie."
Barak Ravid
Haaretz Correspondent
